com.awirtz.util
Class RingBuffer

java.lang.Object
  com.awirtz.util.RingBuffer

public class RingBuffer
extends java.lang.Object

A ring buffer implementation on top of a byte array.

Author:
Aaron Meriwether

RingBuffer

public RingBuffer(int size)
Create a new RingBuffer of the specified size.

Parameters:
size - The size in bytes of the RingBuffer.

Turn an existing byte array into a RingBuffer.

Parameters:
buffer - A byte array to be used as a RingBuffer.

RingBuffer

public RingBuffer(byte[] buffer,
                  int tail,
                  int length)
Turn a byte array which already contains data into a RingBuffer.

Parameters:
buffer - A byte array to be used as a RingBuffer.
tail - The pointer to the beginning of the data in the array.
length - The length of the data in the array.
Method Detail

write

public int write(byte[] buffer,
                 int offset,
                 int length)
Write to the RingBuffer from a byte array. If the write exceeds the free space in the RingBuffer, only part of the data will be written.

Parameters:
buffer - A byte array from which the data will be copied.
offset - The offset in the byte array where the data begins.
length - The number of bytes to be written.
Returns:
The number of bytes successfully written to the RingBuffer. This may be less than the requested length if there is insufficient free space in the RingBuffer, or zero if the RingBuffer is full.

writer

public int writer(RingBufferWriter writer,
                  int length)
Perform a write operation via callbacks on a supplied object. This is basically an inversion of the RingBuffer "write" method in which the caller to supplies its own simple "write" method which will be invoked zero, one, or two times against the RingBuffer's internal byte array to complete the operation. This is useful to avoid an intermediate buffer when reading from a source into a RingBuffer.

Parameters:
writer - An object implementing the RingBufferWriter interface.
length - The number of bytes to be written.
Returns:
The number of bytes successfully written to the RingBuffer. This may be less than the requested length if there is insufficient free space in the RingBuffer, or zero if the RingBuffer is full.

read

public int read(byte[] buffer,
                int offset,
                int length)
Read from the RingBuffer into a byte array.

Parameters:
buffer - A byte array in which the read data will be placed.
offset - The offset in the byte array where the read data should be placed.
length - The number of bytes to be read.
Returns:
The number of bytes successfully read from the RingBuffer. This may be less than the requested length if there were fewer bytes in the buffer, or zero if the buffer was empty.

reader

public int reader(RingBufferReader reader,
                  int length)
Perform a read operation via callbacks on a supplied object. This is basically an inversion of the RingBuffer "read" method in which the caller to supplies its own simple "read" method which will be invoked zero, one, or two times against the RingBuffer's internal byte array to complete the operation. This is useful to avoid an intermediate buffer when reading from a RingBuffer into a destination.

Parameters:
reader - An object implementing the RingBufferReader interface.
length - The number of bytes to be read.
Returns:
The number of bytes successfully read from the RingBuffer. This may be less than the requested length if there were fewer bytes in the buffer, or zero if the buffer was empty.

Get the length of the data contained in the RingBuffer.

The length of the data in bytes.

The maximum capacity in bytes.
